title: Mixed ergodic optimization
abstract:
In this article, we introduce an ergodic optimization problem inspired by
information theory, which can be presented informally as follows: given
topological dynamical systems $(X, T), (Y, \nu)$, and a continuous function $f
\in C(X \times Y)$, what can be said about the extrema $$\sup_{y \in Y} \inf_{x
\in X} \lim_{k \to \infty} \frac{1}{k} \sum_{j = 0}^{k - 1} f \left( T^j x ,
S^j y \right) ? $$ Our goal in this article is to formalize this problem,
present some preliminary results on the topic, and note some remaining open
questions in the general theory.
